question: A ball is thrown horizontally from a cliff with an initial velocity of 20 m/s. Neglecting air resistance, what is the ball's velocity 2 seconds after it is thrown?

choices.C: 24.3 m/s at an angle of 26.1° below the horizontal
choices.D: 28.3 m/s at an angle of 45° below the horizontal

solution: In projectile motion with no air resistance, horizontal velocity remains constant while vertical velocity changes due to gravity. After 2 seconds, the horizontal velocity is still 20 m/s. The vertical velocity can be found using v = gt, where g is -9.8 m/s^2 (negative for downward acceleration). Thus, the vertical velocity is (-9.8 m/s^2)(2 s) = -19.6 m/s. The negative sign indicates the ball is moving downward. Therefore, after 2 seconds, the ball's velocity is 20 m/s horizontally and 19.6 m/s vertically downward.
